keyTakeAways: The U.S. government is in a 17-day shutdown, leading President Trump's administration to furlough approximately 1,400 workers at the National Nuclear Security Administration (NNSA).
The furloughs are being attributed to the Democratic leadership in the Senate, particularly Senator Chuck Schumer, whose opposition to funding legislation is cited as the cause of the shutdown.
The NNSA is responsible for overseeing the U.S. nuclear weapons stockpile and securing nuclear materials globally, including in Ukraine amid Russian military aggression.
Approximately 750,000 federal employees have been furloughed, including tens of thousands of contractors, with NNSA's 60,000 contractors maintaining and testing nuclear weapons.
Energy Secretary Chris Wright stated that the shutdown will slow progress in modernizing the U.S. nuclear arsenal and criticized the political deadlock.
Nuclear weapons expert Daryl Kimball criticized the furloughs, arguing that the administration should fund essential NNSA operations rather than cut workers during a shutdown.
The Trump administration previously terminated NNSA employees as part of Elon Musk’s short-lived Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) initiative, which was quickly reversed.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The Trump administration has announced plans to furlough approximately 1,400 workers at the National Nuclear Security Administration (NNSA), citing the 17-day government shutdown caused by Senate Democrats, particularly Senator Chuck Schumer, blocking funding legislation. The move undermines critical efforts to modernize the U.S. nuclear arsenal and affects both federal employees and thousands of contractors maintaining nuclear weapons. Energy Secretary Chris Wright criticized the shutdown, warning that unpaid work will slow progress in nuclear modernization. The furloughs come amid broader government-wide impacts, with over 750,000 federal employees affected, including NNSA’s 60,000 contractors. Critics, including nuclear expert Daryl Kimball, argue that maintaining essential nuclear safety and global security operations should not be sacrificed during a shutdown. This action also reflects the broader political conflict over federal spending and the previous short-lived DOGE initiative led by Elon Musk, which previously targeted NNSA employees before being reversed.
title: US to furlough nuclear weapons agency workers due to shutdown
